subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: How to Spell...?
msgSnippet: From: feral_primate  ... This debate has been long resolved in the Shavian group. It might be interesting to search the shavian
messageBody:
From: "feral_primate" <feral_primate@...>

> > Also, the Quikscript manual does not clarify what to do for single
> > syllable words that end with a "long E" sound (stressed or
> otherwise).
> > Should all one-syllable words that end in a "long E" sound end with
> > letter #26 or letter #27?
>
> "Money" is spelled with letter #26 (because that's the way many non-
> North Americans pronounce it) and the name "Marie" would be spelled
> with letter #27 because the sound is stressed and all the major
> dialects say this vowel as a "long E" sound.

This debate has been long resolved in the Shavian group. It might be
interesting to search the shavian group archives for "eat vs if".

If by 'non-americans' you mean british people - they speak no differently
from americans in this respect. British people by and large use the "#27"
('ee') sound too. In fact I can't think of a dialect that really does use
"#26" (short 'i') at the ends of words.

Hugh B
